required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mil Familias Cohort Establishment: a Study to Understand Determinants of Diabetes and Its Complications Among US Latinos
clinical_study.official_title: Mil Familias: an Observational Cohort Study to Understand the Impact of Genetics, Biology, Behavior, Psychology, and Society/Environment on Diabetes and Its Complications Among US Latinos

brief_summary.textblock: The Mil Familias Cohort Establishment involves enrolling 1000 Latino families with at least one member in the family having type 2 diabetes, including children and youth, and measuring the 5 determinants of human health: genetics, biology, behavior, psychology, and society/environment.

detailed_description.textblock:
The vision of Mil Familias is to reduce the burden of cardio-metabolic disease among Latino families in Santa Barbara County and beyond. The aim is to establish an observational cohort of 1,000 Latino families, with at least one family member currently living with diabetes, in order to understand better the impact of the 5 determinants of human health (genetics, biology, behavior, psychology, and society/environment) in this population. Once the 1,000-family cohort is established, evidence-based intervention studies will be developed and implemented based on new knowledge, with collaborators from the healthcare, public policy, academic, pharmaceutical, medical device and technology industries. The strategy involves 4 coordinated and iterative components to achieve its mission:
1. Especialistas: Trusted, bilingual community health workers specially-trained in diabetes education, clinical research methodologies, and care referral. The Especialistas will engage directly with participants to conduct research activities, answer questions, and when necessary, refer participants to appropriate, local community resources.
2. Data: Facilitated by Especialistas, each individual participant will contribute information on up to 100 different variables relating to their genetics, biology, psychology, behavior and society/environment, thus creating a one-of-a-kind database and associated specimen biobank on Latino health and lifestyle ("Living Information Bank").
3. Interventions: Based on the data, evidence-based, collaborative, culturally-relevant prevention and treatment strategies are planned to develop once the cohort of 1,000 families has been established.
4. Allies: This community-based participatory research study requires engagement from key stakeholders from the Latino community, healthcare sectors, hospitals, payers, businesses, people with diabetes and philanthropists. Organizations and individuals support Mil Familias by contributing their resources, experiences, and skill-sets.

primary_outcome.measure: Success (evaluated by Yes/No format) recruiting and establishing an observational cohort of 1,000 Latino families with at least one family member living with type 2 diabetes by deploying the methods proven feasible by Mil Familias Operational Pilot.
primary_outcome.description: The Mil Familias Cohort Establishment will expand upon the Mil Familias Operational Pilot cohort and infrastructure to collect and store the up to 100 proposed variables across the 5 determinants of human health to support long-term Mil Familias implementation. The variables pertaining to each participant will be collected and stored at the initial visit and then annually for up to 3 years. Socio-demographic characteristics of the cohort will be described at enrollment by type 2 diabetes status, including age, gender, self-identified race/ethnicity, number of people in household, education, insurance, income, occupation, HbA1c, and country of birth.

secondary_outcome.measure: Socio-demographics assessed by questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Introductory interview/ demographics/ contacts and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Socio-demographics measured by questionnaire - including age, gender, self-identified race/ethnicity, contact information, number in household, income, education, marital status, occupation, caring for elder, night shifts, insurance status, insurance type and payer, influenza immunization status, immigration status, alcohol & tobacco use, birth place,and duration of time in the United States (<5 years, 5-9 years, 10-14 years, 15-19 years, 20-24 years, â‰¥25 years).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of healthcare visits and the difficulty in traveling to the healthcare provider assessed by questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Introductory interview/ demographics/ contacts and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of visits to a healthcare provider in the last year and difficulty in traveling to a healthcare provider measured by interview questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Questions regarding personal opinions regarding the burden of diabetes on Latinos measured by specific questions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Introductory interview/ demographics/ contacts and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Personal opinion regarding type 2 diabetes burden on Latinos measured by 3 questions - why is diabetes common in Latinos, what can be done to prevent diabetes in Latinos, and what things make it difficult to get help with diabetes when it is needed?

secondary_outcome.measure: Total daily tortilla consumption
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Introductory interview/ demographics/ contacts and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The number of flour and/or corn tortillas consumed daily for the past 30 days is estimated

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily sugary drink consumption
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Introductory interview/ demographics/ contacts and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Daily sugary drink consumption is measured by the 2 questions in the Sugar Sweetened Beverages module of the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System Questionnaire from the Centers for Disease Control.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of times per week eating meals prepared away from home
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Introductory interview/ demographics/ contacts and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: NHANES 2017-2018 question asked - During the past 7 days, how many meals did you get that were prepared away from home in places such as restaurants, fast food places, food stands, grocery stores, or from vending machines?

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of C-Peptide related to diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: C-Peptide, ng/mL, will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of C-Reactive protein related to diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: C-Reactive protein, mg/L, will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of Complete Blood Count
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Blood Count will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of Comprehensive Metabolic Panel
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comprehensive Metabolic Panel will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of Glutamic Acid Decarboxylase (GAD) antibodies related to diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Glutamic Acid Decarboxylase (GAD) antibodies, U/mL, will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of HbA1c related to diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c % will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of Insulin autoantibody related to diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Insulin autoantibody, U/mL, will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of Islet antigen 2 (IA-2) antibody related to diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Islet antigen 2 (IA-2) antibody, U/mL, will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of lipids
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Lipids will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of Insulin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Insulin, milliunits/L, will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Laboratory blood draw for evaluation of thyroid function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Thyroid function will measured in a laboratory blood draw sample.

secondary_outcome.measure: Microalbumin measured in a urine sample
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urine sample collected for measuring microalbumin mg/L

secondary_outcome.measure: Creatinine measured in a urine sample
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urine sample collected for measuring creatinine

secondary_outcome.measure: Microalbumin/creatinine ratio measured in a urine sample
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Urine sample collected for measuring the microalbumin/creatinine ratio

secondary_outcome.measure: Cheek cells and saliva for genomic analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Cheek epithelial cells from a swab and saliva samples will be collected for genetic analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Stool samples for microbiome analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Stool/fecal samples will be collected for microbiome analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Height measured by Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Height measured in centimeters or inches by physical exam

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight measured by Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Weight measured in kilograms or pounds by physical exam

secondary_outcome.measure: Waist circumference measured by Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Waist circumference measured in centimeters or inches by physical exam

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood pressure measured by Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure, systolic and diastolic, measured in mmHg by physical exam

secondary_outcome.measure: Temperature measured by Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Temperature measured in degrees by physical exam

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate measured by Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate measured in beats per minute by physical exam

secondary_outcome.measure: Foot examination evaluated by Questions and Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Foot examination with yes or no questions and by physical exam

secondary_outcome.measure: Neuropathy Questions during Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Questions about neuropathy

secondary_outcome.measure: Retinopathy questions during Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Questions about retinopathy

secondary_outcome.measure: Dental exam Questions during Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Questions about dental exams

secondary_outcome.measure: Eye exam Questions during Physical exam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Questions about eye exams

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical history, family medical history, and medication status and history assessed by interview
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Medical history including date of diabetes diagnosis, family medical history, and current medications verified by visual inspection and medication history assessed by interview questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Menopausal status, pregnancy status, and gestational diabetes history for women determined by interview
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Physical exam encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Menopausal status, pregnancy status (number of live births, number of stillbirths, birthweights of live births, and any diagnosis of type 1 diabetes), and gestational diabetes history for female participants will be determined by interview

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of diabetes related foot disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire for determination of diabetes related foot disease (Q-DFD)

secondary_outcome.measure: Acculturation measured by the Brief Acculturation Scale for Hispanics (BASH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaire encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: BASH is a participant reported questionnaire to measure acculturation. Responses are scored as 1 = only Spanish, 2 = Spanish more than English, 3 = Spanish and English equally, 4 = English more than Spanish, and 5 = only English. Items are summed and divided by the number of items. Low acculturation is less than or equal to 3.0, and high acculturation is greater than or equal to 3.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured by the Short Form Health Survey (SF-12)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-12 is a participant reported questionnaire to measure quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression measured by the Patient Health Questionnaire-9
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ)-9 is the Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) module of the full PHQ

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Ethnic Discrimination measured by the Brief Perceived Ethnic Discrimination Questionnaire - Community version (PEDQ-CV)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: PEDQ-CV is a participant reported questionnaire to measure perceived ethnic discrimination

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) quantified by ACE questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) refers to a range of events that a child can experience, which lead to stress and can result in trauma and chronic stress responses. An ACE score will be quantified by a specific ACE questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Spirituality measured by a Spiritual Well Being Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT" (Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy) Sp-12 is a questionnaire for measuring spiritual well being. Questions are scored from 0 = Not at all to 4 = Very much. Sub-scales are created for meaning, peace, and faith with score ranges of 0 - 16. Adding these 3 scores gives a total score and the range is 0 - 48 with low scores indicating low spiritual well being and high scores indicating higher spiritual well being.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk Perception Survey For Developing Diabetes (RPS-DD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Diabetes risk perception will be measured by the Risk Perception Survey For Developing Diabetes (RPS-DD)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep quality measured by the Oviedo Sleep Questionnaire (OSQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The OSQ is a participant reported questionnaire to measure sleep quality

secondary_outcome.measure: Stress measured by the 4 item Perceived Stress Scale (PSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: PSS is a participant reported questionnaire to measure stress. The scale ranges from 0 = never to 4 = very often. The final score ranges from 0 - 16, with higher scores indicating more stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Drug abuse measured by the Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST) - 20
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The purpose of the DAST-20 is to provide a brief, simple, practical, but valid method for identifying individuals who are abusing psychoactive drugs; and to yield a quantitative index score of the degree of problems related to drug use and misuse

secondary_outcome.measure: Diabetes management measured by the Diabetes Symptom Self-Care Inventory
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Ability to manage diabetes self-care assessed by the Diabetes Symptom Self-Care Inventory (DSSCI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Family diabetes management measured by questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Family diabetes Self-Efficacy for management of diabetes measured by questionnaire (FSE)

secondary_outcome.measure: Foot self care confidence measured by questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Foot Care Confidence Scale (FCCS) is an instrument designed to measure the confidence (self-efficacy) of individuals with type 2 diabetes to perform foot self care

secondary_outcome.measure: Health literacy measured by the Short Assessment of Health Literacy (SAHL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: SAHL is a participant reported questionnaire to measure health literacy

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement of health numeracy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Newest Vital Sign (NVS) is a tool to assess health literacy and numeracy in English and Spanish

secondary_outcome.measure: Trust in physician measured by the Trust in Physician (TPS) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The TPS is a questionnaire and scale to determine trust in the physician

secondary_outcome.measure: Social needs screening assessed by the Health Leads Screening toolkit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The Health Leads Screening tookit (Boston, MA) will be used to determine social needs - housing instability, childcare, utility needs, financial resource strain, transportation, and exposure to violence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Food security assessed by U.S. Household Food Security Survey Module: Six-item short form
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Food security or insecurity assessed by a six-item short form developed by the Economic Research Service, United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), September 2012

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional support measured by the SSQ6
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Social Support Questionnaire - Short Form (SSQ6) measures functional social support

secondary_outcome.measure: Support structure measured by Medical Outcomes Study Social Support Survey (mMOS-SS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The eight-item modified Medical Outcomes Study Social Support Survey (mMOS-SS) measures support structure by counting the number of people supporting and satisfaction with that support

secondary_outcome.measure: National survey of children's health (NSCH) for all children and youth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Questionnaires encounter and annually up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: The NSCH, a validated survey of children's health and translated into Spanish, will assess health of children and youth

other_outcome.measure: Physical activity measured by two wearable physical activity monitors for 1 week
other_outcome.time_frame: On-going activity encounter up to twice in 1 year
other_outcome.description: Participants wear an ActiGraph and Fitbit activity monitors simultaneously for 1 week, complete an activity log, and answer a user experience questionnaire.

arm_group.description: Individuals â‰¥18 years of Hispanic/Latino heritage with an established diagnosis of type 2 diabetes
Adult family members, â‰¥18 years, of the individual with type 2 diabetes
Child, â‰¥7 years but <18 years, family member with diabetes
Child, â‰¥7 years but <18 years, family member without diabetes

biospec_descr.textblock: Serum, plasma, buffy coat (white cells), saliva, feces, urine, cheek cells

study_pop.textblock: Up to 1,200 families may be screened and enrolled with the prediction of 20% screen-fail or dropout and 1,000 families enrolled in the study. A "family" will be followed as one unit but is estimated to include on average 3 to 5 individuals based on the findings from the Operational Pilot. Up to 6,000 individuals may be enrolled in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Males or females â‰¥ 7 years of age at enrollment.
2. Self-reported Latino heritage.
3. Co-resides with immediate family member (as defined above) OR self with established diagnosis of Type 2 Diabetes for at least one year prior to enrollment date.
4. Signed and dated written informed consent by the date of enrollment.
5. Based on the research staff's judgment, subject or subject's representative must have a good understanding, ability, and willingness to adhere to the protocol, including performance of self-monitored data collection during the wearable device portion.
-
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Life expectancy < 6 months.
2. Any active clinically significant physical or mental disease or disorder, which in the investigator's opinion could interfere with the participation of the trial.
3. Language barriers precluding comprehension of study activities and informed consent.
4. Participation in other trials involving medication or device within 1 month prior to enrollment.
5. Known or suspected abuse of alcohol, narcotics, or illicit drugs. -

patient_data.ipd_description: All individual participant data (IPD) that underlie results in publications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be made available after the primary publication of each analysis.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data Sharing Agreements will be formulated by a committee of study investigators and community and industry partners.
